summary:
The Security Council,
Reaffirming the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations and its relevant resolutions, particularly resolution 1373 (2001), 
Condemns in the strongest terms the 7 February 2003 bomb attack in Bogota, Colombia, regarding it as a threat to peace and security. 
Expresses deepest sympathy to Colombia, the victims and their families. 
Urges States to cooperate with Colombia to find and bring to justice the perpetrators, organizers and sponsors of the attack, in accordance with resolution 1373 (2001). 
Reiterates its determination to combat all forms of terrorism, in accordance with its responsibilities under the Charter.
